All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AboutPanel
The panel with the infos "about this application".
Action
A list of the action commands.
ChessCheckBox
A JCheckBox that can tell us the width and height of the label text.
ChessClockFrame
Is the main class and integrates the components.
ChessLabel
A JLabel with additional functions for retrieving width and height of the displayed string.

User input that it displayed on a chess label (chess label on the identity panels), enters the program here, hence this class participates in the boundary of trust against user input in text fields.
ClockPanel
The clock panel displays the clock.
Constants
Some constants.
Countries
List of countries.
Country
The data of a country is an individual ID code, a key string to its name in the currently used localisation object, a further key to the county key code in the localisation, and a string with the name of the flag.
The ID code is used for array access, thus these values must be positive.
CountryCodes
This interface provides the key strings that lead to the country codes in the localization.
CountryContainer
Links a Country with the localized name.
CountryNames
This interface provides the key strings that lead to the names of the countries.
EmptyLocalization
An empty localization where nearly every string is the empty one ("").
EnglishLocalization
An English (uk) localization.
GameSettingsPanel
The panel for the settings for the game time control.
LaunchThread
The thread that does all the launching work.
LimitedTextField
A JTextField that can take only a limited amount of characters.
LoadPanel
Panel displayed while loading and initializing the application.
Loc
An abstract localisation.
The constant fields of this class are used as keys for the data base.
MasterFrame
 
PlayerData
A complete list of a player's data required for a game.
SettingsPanel
The panel for the settings.
Util
Some handy utility methods.
